subject: ovn: Always use UTC for Hash ring timestamps
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-21 13:12:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/b5856cf8a5c1e7355c54e8e09636458d5226cd0a', 'message': 'ovn: Always use UTC for Hash ring timestamps

When a node is created in ovn_hash_ring table, it used to use timestamp
depending on the system or mysql timezone. This caused troubles for
machines using western timezones when getting active nodes before the
first liveness check, becaus the time difference between UTC and local
time was always in hours and the limit is 30 seconds.

This patch configures OVN Hash Ring model to always use UTC when
creating a node so the times are always compared to UTC, regardless of
the used timezone. Note that the created_at and updated_at are not user
facing columns.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ovn_hash_ring_db.py

commit_message:
ovn: Always use UTC for Hash ring timestamps

When a node is created in ovn_hash_ring table, it used to use timestamp
depending on the system or mysql timezone. This caused troubles for
machines using western timezones when getting active nodes before the
first liveness check, becaus the time difference between UTC and local
time was always in hours and the limit is 30 seconds.

This patch configures OVN Hash Ring model to always use UTC when
creating a node so the times are always compared to UTC, regardless of
the used timezone. Note that the created_at and updated_at are not user
facing columns.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ovn_hash_ring_db.py

Change-Id: I9172254ce9b1880833128bdcaacacb93821933dd
Closes-bug: #1894117
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a84462f698f91b10e332e3403ecc9a68c3e6a884)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/45/752945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # created_at and updated_at differ in microseonds so we compare their # difference is less than a second to be safe on slow machines dont_cache = nodes and ( nodes[0].updated_at - nodes[0].created_at < datetime.timedelta( seconds=1))

commit_message:
Install last stable version of get-pip.py script

The get-pip script does not work well with Python 2 and
it raise error during the installation [1].

[1] https://github.com/pypa/get-pip/issues/83

Change-Id: I3755c34da313ef647547c6ae18b59cc04c2cdd60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/54/772254/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "${_do_py3}" -eq 0 ]; then # install the latest python2 pip; this overwrites packaged pip # NOTE(dpawlik) The new version on get-pip does not work well # with python2: https://github.com/pypa/get-pip/issues/83, so # temporary install latest stable version. python /tmp/get-pip-3.4.py ${pip_args} else python /tmp/get-pip.py ${pip_args} fi # NOTE(dpawlik) The new version on get-pip does not work well # with python2: https://github.com/pypa/get-pip/issues/83, so # temporary install latest stable version. python2 /tmp/get-pip-3.4.py $pip_args
deleted_lines: # install the latest python2 pip; this overwrites packaged pip python /tmp/get-pip.py ${pip_args} python2 /tmp/get-pip.py $pip_args

commit_message:
Update SSL instructions to new standard

Updating the documentation to recommend
using the new standard for generating ssl
certificates with alt_names. The use of
CommonNames has been deprecated for some time.

Closes #1906387

Change-Id: Ifb02aa5007b74b25936b4ae253e493747039b229
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/01/771901/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: public VIP. To do this, we will create two files for the certificate request. First, we create the server.csr.cnf:: [req] default_bits = 2048 prompt = no default_md = sha256 distinguished_name = dn [dn] C=AU ST=Queensland L=Brisbane O=bne-home OU=admin emailAddress=me@example.com CN=openstack.example.com Create v3.ext:: authorityKeyIdentifier=keyid,issuer basicConstraints=CA:FALSE keyUsage = digitalSignature, nonRepudiation, keyEncipherment, dataEncipherment subjectAltName = @alt_names [alt_names] DNS.1=openstack.example.com Create the Key:: openssl req -new -sha256 -nodes -out server.csr \ -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout server-key.pem \ -config <( cat server.csr.cnf ) Create the certificate:: openssl x509 -req -in server.csr \ -CA overcloud-cacert.pem \ -CAkey overcloud-ca-privkey.pem \ -CAcreateserial -out server-cert.pem \ -days 500 -sha256 -extfile v3.ext
deleted_lines: public VIP. Again, Most of the fields don't matter, but this is where the Common Name must be set to the fixed IP in the external network allocation pool:: openssl req -newkey rsa:2048 -days 365 \ -nodes -keyout server-key.pem -out server-req.pem Process the server RSA key:: openssl rsa -in server-key.pem -out server-key.pem Sign the leaf certificate with the CA certificate and generate the certificate:: openssl x509 -req -in server-req.pem -days 365 \ -CA overcloud-cacert.pem -CAkey overcloud-ca-privkey.pem \ -set_serial 01 -out server-cert.pem

commit_message:
We don't have to disable validations anymore for pre-deployed OC

Following the Depends-On patch, we don't have to pass the
--disable-validations flag anymore when we deploy the OC on pre-deployed
nodes.

The doc still keep the mention of the option for a specific usecase
since it does make sense, for the sake of making Operator's life easier.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/771960

Change-Id: I87be5bf25f4ff3f6bfc2ccb311c5f0c9dea5a9bc

commit_message:
Avoid distro installing unused services

When performing a distro_install avoid installing services where they
are not needed.  The services are started automatically and are
consuming resources.  Add additional variables to differentiate between
source and distro package installs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/636162
Change-Id: I519db8218aeb07d8fca0de595a986e264be7f545

commit_message:
Optimize get_ports with trunk extension

Use case: many trunk ports (300+) each with many subports.
Issue: get_ports takes much time.
Solution: apply trunk resource extend func for a full list of ports,
not for each port individually, thus avoiding a DB query for each
trunk port.

The approach will be extended for other resource extenders, like QoS,
and probably for other resources as well.
QoS: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764454

Change-Id: Ic08e4049f6156c0700ca3c7aee251b6eb0eb97da
Closes-Bug: #1905268
(cherry picked from commit e007349d47812f2307e8951ed44f3c392089bb3b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/01/772401/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-19 16:32:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_archive.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/09784db62fcd01124a101c4c69cab6e71e1ac781', 'message': 'Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up
"residue" of deleted instance records by assuming any table with a
'instance_uuid' column represents data tied to an instance's lifecycle
and delete such records.

This behavior poses a problem in the case where an instance has a PCI
device allocated and someone deletes the instance. The 'instance_uuid'
column in the pci_devices table is used to track the allocation
association of a PCI with an instance. There is a small time window
during which the instance record has been deleted but the PCI device
has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as PCI
devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the compute
manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residue to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6
(cherry picked from commit 1c256cf774693e2395ae8fe4a7a2f416a7aeb03a)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up
"residue" of deleted instance records by assuming any table with a
'instance_uuid' column represents data tied to an instance's lifecycle
and delete such records.

This behavior poses a problem in the case where an instance has a PCI
device allocated and someone deletes the instance. The 'instance_uuid'
column in the pci_devices table is used to track the allocation
association of a PCI with an instance. There is a small time window
during which the instance record has been deleted but the PCI device
has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as PCI
devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the compute
manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residue to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6
(cherry picked from commit 1c256cf774693e2395ae8fe4a7a2f416a7aeb03a)

subject: Use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for (system_)metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-07 11:13:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/12dbfec3ef4d1298a075bcd94ab3c5d8e7af5475', 'message': 'Use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for (system_)metadata

Currently, when we "get" a single instance from the database and we
load metadata and system_metadata, we do so using a joinedload() which
does JOINs with the respective tables. Because of the one-to-many
relationship between an instance and (system_)metadata records, doing
the database query this way can result in a large number of additional
rows being returned unnecessarily and cause a large data transfer.

This is similar to the problem addressed by change
I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9 which added separate queries
for (system_)metadata when we "get" multiple instances. We don't,
however, reuse the same code for this change because
_instances_fill_metadata converts the instance database object to a
dict, and some callers of _instance_get_by_uuid need to be able to
access an instance database object attached to the session (example:
instance_update_and_get_original).

By using subqueryload() [1], we can perform the additional queries for
(system_)metadata to solve the problem with a similar approach.

Closes-Bug: #1799298

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/loading_relationships.html#subquery-eager-loading

commit_message:
Use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for (system_)metadata

Currently, when we "get" a single instance from the database and we
load metadata and system_metadata, we do so using a joinedload() which
does JOINs with the respective tables. Because of the one-to-many
relationship between an instance and (system_)metadata records, doing
the database query this way can result in a large number of additional
rows being returned unnecessarily and cause a large data transfer.

This is similar to the problem addressed by change
I0610fb16ccce2ee95c318589c8abcc30613a3fe9 which added separate queries
for (system_)metadata when we "get" multiple instances. We don't,
however, reuse the same code for this change because
_instances_fill_metadata converts the instance database object to a
dict, and some callers of _instance_get_by_uuid need to be able to
access an instance database object attached to the session (example:
instance_update_and_get_original).

By using subqueryload() [1], we can perform the additional queries for
(system_)metadata to solve the problem with a similar approach.

Closes-Bug: #1799298

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/loading_relationships.html#subquery-eager-loading

Change-Id: I5c071f70f669966e9807b38e99077c1cae5b4606
(cherry picked from commit e728fe668a6de886455f2dbaf655c8a151462c8c)
(cherry picked from commit 63d2e62c3a223f883ca810f4c66a2a236cf3d483)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/761810/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy.orm import subqueryload elif column in ['metadata', 'system_metadata']: # NOTE(melwitt): We use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for # metadata and system_metadata because of the one-to-many # relationship of the data. Directly joining these columns can # result in a large number of additional rows being queried if an # instance has a large number of (system_)metadata items, resulting # in a large data transfer. Instead, the subqueryload() will # perform additional queries to obtain metadata and system_metadata # for the instance. query = query.options(subqueryload(column)) # NOTE(melwitt): We need to use order_by(<unique column>) so that the # additional queries emitted by subqueryload() include the same ordering as # used by the parent query. # https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/loading_relationships.html#the-importance-of-ordering return query.order_by(models.Instance.id)

commit_message:
Change how ovn mech driver checks if vlan transparency is supported

Previously ovn mech driver was supporting vlan transparency for all
types of networks.
But it's not that easy and for flat networks it doesn't work (at least
for now). So this patch changes the way how check_vlan_transparency()
method is implemented in ovn mech_driver.

Change-Id: Ie5357980f70e4853f320785258cbb6bb603cc104

commit_message:
libvirt: Only add a USB controller if it's necessary

Libvirt will add a USB controller by default on x86-64 hosts. This is
legacy behavior due to QEMU's historical behaviour of not providing a
way to disable them. However, a USB controller is both unnecessary and
in some cases (real-time) actively harmful if there are no guest devices
that rely on the USB bus.

The libvirt documentation suggests that there are a number of devices
that can use a USB bus: input devices, various types of disk device, hub
devices, USB serial ports, sound devices, and host passthrough and
redirected USB devices. Of these, nova supports only the first two. Add
a check for these devices and if present, add a controller, else disable
the controller.

Change-Id: I5b16d9ddc9cad56b367d1ad94abba95d675840b0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
policy: Remove the deprecated 'placement' rule

The 'placement' rule pre-dates the granular policies introduced in the
Rocky release, back when placement was still part of nova. It's no
longer used anywhere and can/should be removed.

This commit also updates a policy test to use a registered policy,
instead of the `placement` rule we're removing here.  Otherwise, the
`authorize()` implementation will fail because the rule isn't officially
registered by placement.

Change-Id: I4b34c86a1991f954fc562b8e252fe9a178a08ad7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/33/772333/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Default to cinder v3 in cloud config

Change Ib4f918c01e2fc71eedf7e6c90ca1dc5ccf8ff688 removed the cinder v2
API keystone service and endpoints. However some applications fail to
detect the supported cinder API versions and still default to v2.
See for example how Gophercloud [1] selects which API version to use.

This changes the default cinder API to v3 in the generated cloud config.

[1] https://github.com/gophercloud/utils/blob/6f54843/openstack/clientconfig/requests.go#L902-L918

Change-Id: I3fb719c2b8c92d2aebb76698674ada6b69ad2c8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/77/771977/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for inventories

This commit updates the policies for the inventories resource in
placement to support read-only roles.

This is part of a broader community effort to support read-only roles
and implement secure, consistent default policies.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9add612f1533d0810cbfd0eadc358759e285ab6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/38/760238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import versionutilsDEPRECATED_REASON = """ The inventory API now supports a read-only role by default. """ deprecated_list_inventories = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=LIST, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) deprecated_show_inventory = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=SHOW, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) base.SYSTEM_READER, scope_types=['system'], deprecated_rule=deprecated_list_inventories, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY), base.SYSTEM_READER, scope_types=['system'], deprecated_rule=deprecated_show_inventory, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY),

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for usage

This commit updates the policies for the usage resource in
placement to support read-only roles.

This is part of a broader community effort to support read-only roles
and implement secure, consistent default policies.

This commit also allows project readers to see project-specific usages,
resolve a long-standing policy TODO.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I80afaae965d3c5f862320ac11a7d05db2f6b6553
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/42/760242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import versionutilsDEPRECATED_REASON = """ The usage API now supports a read-only role by default. """ deprecated_list_rp_usages = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=PROVIDER_USAGES, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) deprecated_list_total_usages = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=TOTAL_USAGES, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) base.SYSTEM_READER, scope_types=['system'], deprecated_rule=deprecated_list_rp_usages, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY), base.SYSTEM_READER, scope_types=['system'] deprecated_rule=deprecated_list_total_usages, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for traits

This commit updates the policies for traits in placement to support read-only
roles.

This is part of a broader community effort to support read-only roles
and implement secure, consistent default policies.

Change-Id: I5aec5f0ad24acd2c14c85a0a878c50790c2ab415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/41/760241/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import versionutilsDEPRECATED_REASON = """ The traits API now supports a read-only role by default. """ deprecated_list_traits = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=TRAITS_LIST, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) deprecated_show_trait = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=TRAITS_SHOW, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) deprecated_rp_traits_list = policy.DeprecatedRule( name=RP_TRAIT_LIST, check_str=base.RULE_ADMIN_API ) base.SYSTEM_READER, scope_types=['system'], deprecated_rule=deprecated_list_traits, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY base.SYSTEM_READER, deprecated_rule=deprecated_show_trait, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY base.SYSTEM_READER, deprecated_rule=deprecated_rp_traits_list, deprecated_reason=DEPRECATED_REASON, deprecated_since=versionutils.deprecated.WALLABY

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for resource classes

This commit updates the policies for the resource classes in placement to
support read-only roles.

This is part of a broader community effort to support read-only roles
and implement secure, consistent default policies.

Change-Id: Ie56fac6e0714f418b26c875735caf8867a1a1d9f

subject: Change the CLI document for the extend-attached-volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-08-19 13:56:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/97ce3f95b03aee05a74afce5b667f65d92a62165', 'message': "Change the CLI document for the extend-attached-volume

The extend documentation will need to be updated to indicate that a
volume that is attached to an instance can be extended if the driver has
the capability 'in-use-extend'.

Change-Id: I4d0a439dd53fc7eaee38d0a32fe4e6f0ab4fbf9f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-08-27 08:22:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a7ac18682bcc2865d9b61e667cc9188009ba9f0d', 'message': "Change the CLI document for the extend-attached-volume

The extend documentation will need to be updated to indicate that a
volume that is attached to an instance can be extended if the driver has
the capability 'in-use-extend'.

Prior to microversion 3.42 the volume status must be available.
Starting with microversion 3.42, attached volumes with status in-use
may be able to be extended depending on policy and backend volume.

Change-Id: I4d0a439dd53fc7eaee38d0a32fe4e6f0ab4fbf9f
Closes-Bug: #1871759

commit_message:
Change the CLI document for the extend-attached-volume

The extend documentation will need to be updated to indicate that a
volume that is attached to an instance can be extended if the driver has
the capability 'in-use-extend'.

Prior to microversion 3.42 the volume status must be available.
Starting with microversion 3.42, attached volumes with status in-use
may be able to be extended depending on policy and backend storage.

Change-Id: I4d0a439dd53fc7eaee38d0a32fe4e6f0ab4fbf9f
Closes-Bug: #1871759

deleted_lines: #. To resize your volume, you must first detach it from the server.

commit_message:
policy: Suppress policy deprecation warnings

These are making our logs rather horrific. Hide them.

Change-Id: I2853c7bd7c0afdeeed89ef412fc8830f04381d7b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/52/771852/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def init( conf: cfg.ConfigOpts, suppress_deprecation_warnings: bool = False, ): """Init an Enforcer class. Sets the _ENFORCER global. :param conf: A ConfigOpts object to load configuration from. :param suppress_deprecation_warnings: **Test only** Supress policy deprecation warnings to avoid polluting logs. """ # NOTE(gmann): Explictly disable the warnings for policies changing # their default check_str. During the policy-defaults-refresh work, all # the policy defaults have been changed and warnings for each policy # started filling the logs limit for various tool. # Once we move to new defaults only world then we can enable these # warnings again. _enforcer.suppress_default_change_warnings = True _enforcer.suppress_deprecation_warnings = suppress_deprecation_warnings
deleted_lines: def init(conf): """Init an Enforcer class. Sets the _ENFORCER global."""

subject: Introduces MV to add volume type ID in volumes details
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-21 16:21:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a6162a985939508c942bf70851cc371acf342fab', 'message': 'Cinder events fix for Volume type using volume type IDs instead of names

When the event (volume's events) data is created, Cinder is setting the volume type as the volume type ID. On the other hand, the pollsters are always updating the volume_type value in Gnocchi with the event type name. Then, for every volume event that is triggered in Cinder, this value is then updated back to the ID (it is like a "fight" between these two subsystems to see who updates the status last). The thing is that, deleted volumes are not polled. Therefore, the last update is executed by the event processing subsystems, which updates the value to the volume type ID. This explains why only deleted volumes were perceived with the volume type being set as the ID.

To fix this situation. We need to decide which "standard" we want to use. At first sight, it looks more natural (when integrating system-system via API) to use an ID, but for humans when accessing Cinder API, it might be better to see the volume type name instead. Because the API is publicly available, and we never know what consumes it, we believe that changing from volume type name to volume type ID can break things that we are not aware of. On the other hand, fixing the event data should not break anything because we know (hopefully) where that message is pushed to. Therefore, we decided to move on and fix the event creation code, and use the volume type name there.

Change-Id: Icb88faeb00040250a25a5630aeb312a8434ed3c8
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2019-07-01 12:01:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8044fed97155f8980474daa680b6ac7bc3bab3ee', 'message': 'Cinder fix for Volume type value in the API using name instead of ID

This change is a follow up on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666886.

=====================
A bit of context
=====================
When the event (volume's events) data is created, Cinder is setting the
 volume type as the volume type ID. On the other hand, the pollsters
 are always updating the volume_type value in Gnocchi with the event
 type name. Then, for every volume event that is triggered in Cinder,
 this value is updated back to the ID (it is like a "fight"
 between these two subsystems to see who updates the status last).
 The thing is that, deleted volumes are not polled. Therefore, the last
 update is executed by the event processing subsystems, which updates
 the value to the volume type ID. This explains why only deleted
 volumes were perceived with the volume type being set as the ID.

To fix this situation. We need to decide which "standard" we want to
 use. At first, we proposed to fix the Cinder event sub-system. However,
 after the discussions on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666886, the
 community suggested us to fix the Cinder rest API. Therefore, this
 PR is proposing the Cinder Rest API (volume API) to use the volume
 type ID, instead of the volume type name in the "volume_type" attribute.

Change-Id: Icb88faeb00040250a25a5630aeb312a8434ed3c8
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

When a volume events is created, Cinder is setting the
volume type as the volume type ID. On the other hand, the pollsters
are always updating the volume_type value in Gnocchi with the event
type name. Then, for every volume event that is triggered in Cinder,
this value is updated back to the ID (it is like a "fight"
between these two subsystems to see who updates the status last).
The thing is that, deleted volumes are not polled. Therefore, the last
update is executed by the event processing subsystems, which updates
the value to the volume type ID. This explains why only deleted
volumes were perceived with the volume type being set as the ID.

This adds a microversion to the API to return both the volume type name
and ID to provide both values depending on the consumer's needs.

Change-Id: Icb88faeb00040250a25a5630aeb312a8434ed3c8
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

'}, {'number': 32, 'created': '2020-06-16 16:55:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/881d0d43fcc5ee5644b3e2d4595a53129ad4c90a', 'message': 'Introduces MV to add volume type ID in volumes details

Introduces microversion 3.61 to add volume type ID in the volume details.

This change comes to fix a problem we found in gnocchi concerning volumes
monitored data. When a volume event is created, Cinder uses the volume type
as the volume type ID. On the other hand, the Ceilometer pollsters are always
updating the volume_type value in Gnocchi with the volume type(which uses the
volume type name value) that is retrieved in the volume details.

That situation creates a massive number of resource revisions in Gnocchi.
This Microversion along with the Dynamic pollster system in Ceilometer enables
operators to overcome the issue.

Change-Id: Icb88faeb00040250a25a5630aeb312a8434ed3c8
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>
'}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2020-06-16 16:57:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9104f0109f8e9fc6c35db9748350dab981e2882a', 'message': 'Introduces MV to add volume type ID in volumes details

Introduces microversion 3.61 to add volume type ID in the volume details.

This change comes to fix a problem we found in Gnocchi concerning volumes
monitored data. When a volume event is created, Cinder uses the volume type
as the volume type ID. On the other hand, Ceilometer pollsters are always
updating the volume_type value in Gnocchi with the volume type from volume
details API (which uses the volume type name value).

That situation creates a massive number of resource revisions in Gnocchi.
This Microversion along with the Dynamic pollster system in Ceilometer enables
operators to overcome the issue.

Change-Id: Icb88faeb00040250a25a5630aeb312a8434ed3c8
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>

commit_message:
Introduces MV to add volume type ID in volumes details

Introduces microversion (MV) 3.63 to add volume type ID
in the volume details.

This change comes to fix a problem we found in Gnocchi concerning
volumes monitored data. When a volume event is created, Cinder uses
the volume type as the volume type ID. On the other hand, Ceilometer
pollsters are always updating the volume_type value in Gnocchi with the
volume type from volume details API (which uses the volume type name
value).

That situation creates a massive number of resource revisions in
Gnocchi. This MV along with the Dynamic pollster system in Ceilometer
enables operators to overcome the issue.

Closes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1911660

Change-Id: Icb88faeb00040250a25a5630aeb312a8434ed3c8
Signed-off-by: Rafael Weingärtner <rafael@apache.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/86/666886/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: volume_type = db.volume_type_get(context, volume_ref['volume_type_id']) LOG.debug("Volume type name [%s] for volume type id [%s]. We will replace the ID in the volume usage info " "by the volume type name in the that is sent along with the event." % (volume_type['name'], volume_ref['volume_type_id'])) usage_info['volume_type'] = volume_type['name']

commit_message:
Update ACLs of Ironic Projects to allow Edit Hashtags

This patch aims to update the ACL for some of the Ironic
projecsts to allow the edit of hashtags

Projects updated:
- bifrost
- ironic-inspector
- ironic-specs
- ironic-ui
- ironic
- metalsmith
- networking-generic-switch
- sushy
- tenks
- virtualbmc

Change-Id: I736c807030cffff8d9017cbbbc8a252de902d423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/772427/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Edit Hashtags = group ironic-coreEdit Hashtags = group ironic-core

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for aggregates

This commit updates the policies for the aggregates resource in
placement to support read-only roles.

This is part of a broader community effort to support read-only roles
and implement secure, consistent default policies.

Change-Id: I1242287418361ee48940f5bd2ee1bdc72cf1543e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/35/760235/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for resource providers

This commit updates the policies for the resource providers in placement to
support read-only roles.

This is part of a broader community effort to support read-only roles
and implement secure, consistent default policies.

This commit also introduces some testing infrastructure and plumbing
that is useful for implementing protection tests with gabbi. Including
testing for deprecated policies.

Change-Id: Icc904bf325eaa60377171a22a86932135c384e6a

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-26 12:24:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/c22a19a326a511383e34eed3a8297adfd59fe83e', 'message': "policy: Don't persist default rule changes in tests

'oslo.policy' expects a list of default rules be provided when
initialising the enforcer. Unfortunately, it demonstrates a nasty habit
of modifying these defaults once it has them [1]. This can result in

Resolve this by initialising the enforcer with a copy of the default

commit_message:
policy: Don't persist default rule changes in tests

'oslo.policy' expects a list of default rules be provided when
initialising the enforcer. Unfortunately, it demonstrates a nasty habit
of modifying these defaults once it has them [1]. This can result in
configuration from one test bleeding through to the next.

Resolve this by initialising the enforcer with a copy of the default
rules, rather than the originals, allowing 'oslo.policy' to do whatever
it likes to the rules. Ultimately this should probably be fixed in
'oslo.policy', which should be either copying the defaults or creating
new rules based on these defaults, but that needs some thought and can
be done later.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/3.6.0/oslo_policy/policy.py#L762-L764

Change-Id: Ib864606d4cf4a8ecba95386bcc2b8a4bb68f2d17
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Story: 2008556
Task: 41687

commit_message:
Make it possible to override ServiceNetMap per-role

In spine-and-leaf TLS-e deployments as done in OSP13,
services are filter based on role networks when adding
metadata for nova-join. This filtering removes valid
services due to the fact that the roles network does'nt
match the global ServiceNetMap.

Add a role based parameter {{role.name}}ServiceNetMap
that can be used to override the ServiceNetMap per-role
when it's being passed to {{role.name}}ServiceChain and
the {{role.name}} resource group.

Related: RHBZ#1875508
Closes-Bug: #1904482
Change-Id: I56b6dfe8a0e95385e469d9eac97a0ec24e147450
(cherry picked from commit be6a844a79d659525e0feecd5a784e4eb55cb021)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/40/771540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | When deploying a spine-and-leaf (L3 routed architecture) with TLS enabled for internal endpoints the deployment would fail because some roles are not connected to the network mapped to the service in ServiceNetMap. To fix this issue a role specific parameter ``{{role.name}}ServiceNetMap`` is introduced (defaults to: ``{}``). The role specific ServiceNetMap parameter allow the operator to override one or more service network mappings per-role. For example:: ComputeLeaf2ServiceNetMap: NovaLibvirtNetwork: internal_api_leaf2 The role specific ``{{role.name}}ServiceNetMap`` override is merged with the global ``ServiceNetMap`` when it's passed as a value to the ``{{role.name}}ServiceChain`` resources, and the ``{{role.name}}`` resource groups so that the correct network for this role is mapped to the service. Closes bug: `1904482 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1904482>`_.

subject: Do not relabel Swift files on every container start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-20 08:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/swift/swift-storage-container-puppet.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-prevent-relabeling-b9721aa5a1abda6e.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/826221eb4ab86a6709251c2e4b33be1e9305f3c5', 'message': 'Do not relabel Swift files on every container start

Without this patch, files in /srv/node are relabeled on every start of
the account_auditor and/or account_reaper containers. If there are many
files (eg. when using Gnocchi) this will take a long time, sometimes
dozens of minutes per container start, and might result in breaking
upgrades/updates.

Relabeling already happens in step 3, this should be sufficient and

Closes-Bug: 1907070
Change-Id: I172ae8f35df34887aaf61b3e03d5aaab1d462a60
(cherry picked from commit 191d160903d1072d3cfd9a594e79f64cc533b2b1)

commit_message:
Do not relabel Swift files on every container start

Without this patch, files in /srv/node are relabeled on every start of
the account_auditor and/or account_reaper containers. If there are many
files (eg. when using Gnocchi) this will take a long time, sometimes
dozens of minutes per container start, and might result in breaking
upgrades/updates.

Relabeling already happens in step 3, this should be sufficient and
prevent additional delays when (re-) starting containers.

Closes-Bug: 1907070
Change-Id: I172ae8f35df34887aaf61b3e03d5aaab1d462a60
(cherry picked from commit 191d160903d1072d3cfd9a594e79f64cc533b2b1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/45/771545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Do not relabel Swift files on every container (re-)start. These will be relabeled already in step 3 preventing additional delays.

commit_message:
Make all periodic jobs to be voting

It's easier to check what was wrong if jobs in periodic queue
are voting.
It will not block any development so it is safe to do that.

Change-Id: I038f83afb1fd47de8570f526e594c4c69f4bfe19

subject: Fix nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-02-02 17:02:49.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/ca7eed516eb82150446a28bd6ed023d43f9cb1d8', 'message': 'Fix nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool check

nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool is a string, so applying bool filter always
results to false, which ends up in incorrect behaviour and nova does
not use ceph storage for ephemeral drives.

Change-Id: I66decd266655680172c3e272df61313bde652479
Closes-Bug: #1914272
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool check

nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool is a string, so applying bool filter always
results to false, which ends up in incorrect behaviour and nova does
not use ceph storage for ephemeral drives.

Change-Id: I66decd266655680172c3e272df61313bde652479
Closes-Bug: #1914272
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/32/773732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova_libvirt_disk_cachemodes: '{{ (nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool | length > 0) | ternary("network=writeback", "") }}' nova_libvirt_hw_disk_discard: '{{ (nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool | length > 0) | ternary("unmap", "ignore") }}'nova_rbd_inuse: "{{ (nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool | length > 0) or (nova_cinder_rbd_inuse | bool) }}"
deleted_lines: nova_libvirt_disk_cachemodes: '{{ nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool | bool | ternary("network=writeback", "") }}' nova_libvirt_hw_disk_discard: '{{ nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool | bool | ternary("unmap", "ignore") }}'nova_rbd_inuse: "{{ (nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool | bool) or (nova_cinder_rbd_inuse | bool) }}"

commit_message:
Ignore headless services in NP code

Seems like we need special handling of headless services in NP code that
is to ignore them if they have "None" string as a clusterIP.

Change-Id: Ie0fddae10ebddf97e78af85d372317861749d51d
Closes-Bug: 1914377
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/59/773859/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not cluster_ip or cluster_ip == 'None': # Headless services has 'None' as clusterIP.

commit_message:
Fix lxc_hosts_container_image_url condition

lxc_hosts_container_image_url is string, so can't be passed through bool
filter as it will always result as false.

Change-Id: I0f12760840d81c9d73118d63bc0927eab78b9df2
Closes-Bug: #1908544

commit_message:
Drop lower constraints testing

Projects like oslo are dropping lower constraints
testing. There is also discussion to drop it until
we find a proper setup. For details, please follow
the ML thread. TC will have updates soon.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019679.html

story: 2008482
task: 41523

Change-Id: Ia91451c0f93ffe4c7a555874f8f843e01b146df5
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 2fa68f127f9e98d2352796b9c0ae186c1517b213)

commit_message:
[train-only]Tox now checks proper upper constraints file

Not sure if this is something in need of a fix,
without this patch tox uses upper-constrainst.txt file
from the master branch.

The versions are therefore inappropriate.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3b0d4b2a986a08e48919ed13f9b111a84399e6ef

commit_message:
Add validation to verify undercloud.conf content.

This validation checks the correctness of the undercloud.conf
file. The checks run as part of the verification are:
 - All parameters assigned to a file path point to an existing
   file location in the system.
 - No deprecated parameters are included in undercloud.conf
 - All required parameters are present in undercloud.conf
 - No deprecated hw types are included in the enabled_hw_types
   parameters.

Change-Id: Ic543e21c4aa60b05991f0c4866a6408b924304fd
(cherry picked from commit 99fdf8ae6a837ba51751a642b1303a390cd94e80)

commit_message:
Get the undercloud.conf file from where it actually is

Since the deprecation of Mistral in THT, we can't get the path of this
file by using hiera anymore. This patch will get it directly in its
original place ($HOME/undercloud.conf) by using *ansible_env.HOME* fact.

Impacted Validations:
 playbooks/ceilometerdb-size.yaml
 playbooks/check-network-gateway.yaml
 playbooks/check-undercloud-conf.yaml
 playbooks/container-status.yaml
 playbooks/ctlplane-ip-range.yaml
 playbooks/dhcp-provisioning.yaml
 playbooks/neutron-sanity-check.yaml
 playbooks/tls-everywhere-pre-deployment.yaml
 playbooks/tls-everywhere-prep.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-heat-purge-deleted.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-process-count.yaml
 playbooks/undercloud-tokenflush.yaml

This patch also fixes every molecule tests accordingly.

NB: check_network_gateway molecule test is now voting in the CI.

Closes-Bug: 1907553

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iafc38c6cd99edee89ae0305f09fe7080df148331
(cherry picked from commit bc31f762c22b7edffd9429db9f61bbcb0546aa75)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/79/767679/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensure we get needed facts setup: gather_subset: - '!all' - '!any' - '!min' - env path: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/undercloud.conf"
deleted_lines: - name: Get the path of tripleo undercloud config file become: true hiera: name="tripleo_undercloud_conf_file" path: "{{ tripleo_undercloud_conf_file }}"

commit_message:
Add LDAP to Alertmanager

This change adds an apache sidecar to the Alertmanager statefulset
in order to facillitate authentication to the service.

Change-Id: I6e3cfb582251ecd280644439bfbd432a1f86ede3

commit_message:
[OVN] Ensure metadata checksum

Ensure the TCP traffic leaving the OVN metadata namespace has
the checksum correctly populated. This is necessary when the
OVS datapath is "netdev".

Because the overhead added is minimal and only applies to the
metadata traffic inside the metadata namespace, this rule is
always set.

This patch also includes [1], that is a fix needed on top of
this one. [1] fixes who the code retrieves the datapath type,
executing the OVS IDL query to actually retrieve the data
needed.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/772286

Conflicts:
  neutron/tests/functional/agent/ovn/metadata/test_metadata_agent.py

Change-Id: I7e39f40b325a6974a46ed34641cec5226c9e5a3f
Closes-Bug: #1904871
(cherry picked from commit 26a30a3b78bfaf6d3f8ce6271b1a7415440c602c)
(cherry picked from commit 748827923b0f0dc7b95ab149e14e4efea0dfb8f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/772868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix memcached host address.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-02-03 12:36:43.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'zuul.d/ironic-inspector-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/965a4f5086b2fa8a9dd0d80af2be28872db3d44f', 'message': 'Fix memcached host address.

Since pymemcache 3.4.0, localhost will first translate to ipv6 ([::1])
if possible instead of ipv4 (127.0.0.1). Since memcached is running in
the ipv4 interface, we need to point tooz to the right endpoint.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/772684
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iddf558cd598e41ffead11e164ce2fb1720d15f34
(cherry picked from commit 86b974b75ca998caea8ca949f01d514a00e2ff96)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix memcached host address.

Since pymemcache 3.4.0, localhost will first translate to ipv6 ([::1])
if possible instead of ipv4 (127.0.0.1). Since memcached is running in
the ipv4 interface, we need to point tooz to the right endpoint.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/772684
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iddf558cd598e41ffead11e164ce2fb1720d15f34
(cherry picked from commit 86b974b75ca998caea8ca949f01d514a00e2ff96)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/75/773675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a new role parameter rhsm_enforce.

With this new switch we can opt-out enforcement of the subscription
check for some composed role. This is mainly useful for composed Ceph
which have different constraint than other Openstack roles.

Closes-Bug: #1912512
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/771671

Change-Id: I46529ccab6c197da4885950282eb6731e28573d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/76/771676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * rhsm_enforce: (boolean), optional, default to true. Some role may not follow the EUS stream constrain, like CephOSD or composed Ceph Mon/Mgr. This switch ensures that we can model this and disable the check when it's not needed. Note that on non Red Hat environment this switch has no effect.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-19 15:20:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/03b95733d830d7dc3ab8f211813dc65373fce534', 'message': "Fix json to_primitive when using IO OBjects

Currently, using Cinder's backup service with RBD the
backup-create operation gets stuck when logging
('use_json=True' must be set in the config file).

The oslo.log JSONFormatter gets stuck when passing an
RBDVolumeIOWrapper from os-brick. This happens via os-brick's
utils.trace() method which passes a connector containing
{'path': RBDVolumeIOWrapper}.
The oslo.log JSONFormatter format() method calls
oslo_serialization's jsonutils.to_primitive and passes in
this RBDVolumeIOWrapper object.
\xa0
Therefore the to_primitive method eventually calls
RBDVolumeIOWrapper.read(). In order to fix this the current
path avoids mapping io.IOBase objects and fallback the wrapper
RBD volume object.

commit_message:
Fix json to_primitive when using IO OBjects

Currently, using Cinder's backup service with RBD the
backup-create operation gets stuck when logging
('use_json=True' must be set in the config file).

The oslo.log JSONFormatter gets stuck when passing an
RBDVolumeIOWrapper from os-brick. This happens via os-brick's
utils.trace() method which passes a connector containing
{'path': RBDVolumeIOWrapper}.
The oslo.log JSONFormatter format() method calls
oslo_serialization's jsonutils.to_primitive and passes in
this RBDVolumeIOWrapper object.
 
Therefore the to_primitive method eventually calls
RBDVolumeIOWrapper.read(). In order to fix this the current
path avoids mapping io.IOBase objects and fallback the wrapper
RBD volume object.

Co-authored-by: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1908607
Change-Id: I3c416e855cb5f0dc32d14b2749ba92aba8964574
(cherry picked from commit 02037330d863ecbe2471b63bff5461dee6a3c024)
(cherry picked from commit fcd737e2b19a4fee58db79281b336342f0f09d7b)

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7020166bf2d7459ec1a6bf8a6fc02b960f543a28

commit_message:
Exclude system directories (/sys, /proc, /dev) from the shosts file search

This halves the number of files examined by the find module on an ubuntu
focal system and nearly halves the runtime of the task on a ceph backed
VM.

Change-Id: I862351badc70fa091bebf55dd2910cccfa731ca2

commit_message:
Prevent jobs timeouts when running playbook on localhost

When running playbook, don't connect to localhost, just use
undercloud as usual and run localhost tasks with delegate_to.

Change-Id: Ib8e6408f232f65d1b7addf00d89574af114ec809
Close-Bug: 1911451
Co-Authored-By: Sagi Shnaidman

Adds the `[DEFAULT]raw_image_growth_factor` configuration option which
is a scale factor used for estimating the size of a raw image converted
from compact image formats such as QCOW2. By default this is set to 2.0.

When clearing the cache to make space for a converted raw image, the full
virtual size is attempted first, and if not enough space is available a
second attempt is made with the (smaller) estimated size.

from compact image formats such as QCOW2. By default this is set to 2.0.

When clearing the cache to make space for a converted raw image, the full
virtual size is attempted first, and if not enough space is available a
second attempt is made with the (smaller) estimated size.

Story: 1750515
Task: 9791
Change-Id: Id86e7641329a95f71ac005ee448b0ff4d7d0bbcd

commit_message:
Raw image size estimation improved

Adds the `[DEFAULT]raw_image_growth_factor` configuration option which
is a scale factor used for estimating the size of a raw image converted
from compact image formats such as QCOW2. By default this is set to 2.0.

When clearing the cache to make space for a converted raw image, the full
virtual size is attempted first, and if not enough space is available a
second attempt is made with the (smaller) estimated size.

Story: 1750515
Task: 9791
Change-Id: Id86e7641329a95f71ac005ee448b0ff4d7d0bbcd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/544839/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Raw image virtual size used for free space requirement on the local filesystem replaced with qcow image size * 2 heruistic what should make space requirement more realistic.

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also convert the ./glance/tests/etc/policy.json to policy.yaml
file. Replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/773192
Change-Id: I17d0374dd4223688e5f95253802a4ae87377953a

commit_message:
[reno] Stop publishing release notes

Since we copy all release notes to the integrated repo there is not need
in publishing release notes for each repository. We should only verify their
validity and linting.


Change-Id: Idff881e8cb7f351c2d6f5d52f9c606f6f1559d1c

commit_message:
Update vagrant config

* Move to bionic
* Add openSUSE Leap 15
* * Update Bind devstack backend plugin to work on Leap
* Remove port mapping
* Rmove the .gitconfig copy into the VM

Change-Id: I99d228f850e03045febf196f12eef5927f7605b9
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
(cherry picked from commit 3734f2a13f094fe86c354c87e102543f9b1fa006)

commit_message:
Add a workaround for openSUSE

They keep shipping broken bundled packages in their venv module.
While we may want to eventually deprecate openSUSE support, provide
a work around to unbreak people.

Change-Id: Ib5c1730f5325e726bf3aef164cfaef01ad4c7a13
Story: #2008591
Task: #41747
(cherry picked from commit 1c7cefa1d45f7ebb4e3150bbce7f4286826961ed)

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ia3ffea39c995978babaafc9aa5a463e5f3eda1c0

commit_message:
Update doc8 version

The current tacker code base is using old doc8 version 0.6.0,
refer [1] for details.

This patch bumps the latest doc8 lib version, doc8 lib supports
python 3.6 starting from version 0.8.1.[2]

[1] https://pypi.org/project/doc8/0.6.0/
[2] https://pypi.org/project/doc8/

Change-Id: I7dc3fd9a9f0bc909d335ffdec771351c842a30c0

commit_message:
Support feature to attach the existing volume

This patch attaches already created volume to vnf using volume id.
The existing volume id can be added to tosca.nodes.BlockStorage node,
in this case, no new volume will be created while vnf deployment.

Implementation:
* Set tosca.nodes.BlockStorage.Tacker "size" required as false,
  this override property definition mention in
  tosca.nodes.Storage.BlockStorage present in tosca parser.
  Please refer [1] for tosca.nodes.Storage.BlockStorage details.
* Add a local dictionary to store volume id present in
  tosca.nodes.BlockStorage.Tacker. This dictionary is use in
  to determine cinder volume mapping.

Additionally update block_storage_usage_guide.rst with changes
required to attach existing volume.

Added cinderclient in test_requirement for functional test case.
Add release notes for feature.

[1]: http://docs.oasis-open.org/tosca/TOSCA-Simple-Profile-YAML/v1.2/csprd01/TOSCA-Simple-Profile-YAML-v1.2-csprd01.html

Change-Id: If5d386a64f98603de843f96287c1e296ae6a2e1f
Implements: blueprint attach-existing-volume

commit_message:
Add documentation for routed control plane networks

Kayobe currently supports definition of various different networks -
public, internal, tunnel, etc. These typically map to a VLAN or flat
network, with an IP subnet. When a cloud exceeds the size of a single
VLAN/subnet, this approach no longer works.

One way to resolve this is to have multiple subnets that map to a single
logical network, and provide routing between them. This is a similar
concept to neutron's routed networks, but for the control plane.

This change provides documentation for the currently tested parts of
this feature.

Change-Id: Ic06c6d4fff0fa568eb9ed3a9c30ce21c7699d965
Story: 2008180
Task: 40938

subject: Fix json to_primitive when using IO OBjects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-19 15:19:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.serialization/commit/de384d3f9e6485e6ba668da35862973ce81989e1', 'message': "Fix json to_primitive when using IO OBjects

Currently, using Cinder's backup service with RBD the
backup-create operation gets stuck when logging
('use_json=True' must be set in the config file).

The oslo.log JSONFormatter gets stuck when passing an
RBDVolumeIOWrapper from os-brick. This happens via os-brick's
utils.trace() method which passes a connector containing
{'path': RBDVolumeIOWrapper}.
The oslo.log JSONFormatter format() method calls
oslo_serialization's jsonutils.to_primitive and passes in
this RBDVolumeIOWrapper object.
\xa0
Therefore the to_primitive method eventually calls
RBDVolumeIOWrapper.read(). In order to fix this the current
path avoids mapping io.IOBase objects and fallback the wrapper
RBD volume object.

Co-authored-by: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1908607
Change-Id: I3c416e855cb5f0dc32d14b2749ba92aba8964574
(cherry picked from commit 02037330d863ecbe2471b63bff5461dee6a3c024)

commit_message:
Fix json to_primitive when using IO OBjects

Currently, using Cinder's backup service with RBD the
backup-create operation gets stuck when logging
('use_json=True' must be set in the config file).

The oslo.log JSONFormatter gets stuck when passing an
RBDVolumeIOWrapper from os-brick. This happens via os-brick's
utils.trace() method which passes a connector containing
{'path': RBDVolumeIOWrapper}.
The oslo.log JSONFormatter format() method calls
oslo_serialization's jsonutils.to_primitive and passes in
this RBDVolumeIOWrapper object.
 
Therefore the to_primitive method eventually calls
RBDVolumeIOWrapper.read(). In order to fix this the current
path avoids mapping io.IOBase objects and fallback the wrapper
RBD volume object.

Co-authored-by: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1908607
Change-Id: I3c416e855cb5f0dc32d14b2749ba92aba8964574
(cherry picked from commit 02037330d863ecbe2471b63bff5461dee6a3c024)

commit_message:
Fix copying Swift ring files

Ring files are binary formatted and should not be templated. Attempting
to template them causes an error such as the following:

    Template source files must be utf-8 encoded

This change fixes the issue by implementing support for configuration
files that are listed as 'untemplated'.

Change-Id: I9c6b0d9d5e13e8b82ebb8e8a3a0f432efb865e28
Story: 2007297
Task: 38774

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ie53b809ab031525958b58730a12cb37d0bdf5c82
(cherry picked from commit 3799d180978c4354a18815f93ebdceb3104d8fef)

commit_message:
Ensure LANG env is properly set when puppet runs.

Queens adaptation of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/753407

When puppet run it must support UTF-8 or whatever is the locale on the
host.  So we make sure that we pass down the LANG to the container and
that the puppet process collect it properly.

Change-Id: Ieca91d86eda26b0e95d06f3ec78714918e8c3fc0
Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a workaround for openSUSE

They keep shipping broken bundled packages in their venv module.
While we may want to eventually deprecate openSUSE support, provide
a work around to unbreak people.

Change-Id: Ib5c1730f5325e726bf3aef164cfaef01ad4c7a13
Story: #2008591
Task: #41747

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit to 1.6.2

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

sphinx requirement needed to be updated to make requirements-check job
pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I8762bad8821868c97af8114e49f51b6383df3e5c

commit_message:
Spec: Move to use nginx/uWSGI for API services

This spec proposes that we move to a flexible and configurable mechanism
for deploying nginx and uWSGI for each OpenStack API service.

Change-Id: I00325bd90417fb46cd5c66ff3a3b5c00bda83d0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/95/458595/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NGinx & uWSGI for running API services in OpenStack-Ansible ########################################################### :date: 2017-04-20 00:00 :tags: API, wsgi Blueprint on Launchpad: * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+spec/goal-deploy-api-in-wsgi The goal of the efforts described in this spec is to create a uniform mechanism for deploying OpenStack API services utilizing NGinx and uWSGI. This is a community goal. Problem description =================== Currently API services in OSA are a mixture of WSGI apps running behind Apache or NGinx, and Python web-servers. As part of a community effort, upstream projects are going to be adding support for running API services as WSGI applications behind a web server such as NGinx or Apache. As part of the community, OSA needs to achieve this goal along with the upstream projects. Key benefits to OSA: * Flexibility - we can define where the webservers will live * Consistency - all API services deployed in a uniform way. * End-to-end Encryption - a uniform mechanism to deploy SSL certificates for API services. * Performance - there are performance benefits to utilizing a web server such as NGinx. * Service restarts - we should be able to utilize uWSGI & NGinx to reload services in a more efficient manner. Proposed change =============== For all OpenStack API services there are 2 main aspects to the proposed change: uWSGI changes: Implement each service as a uWSGI application running on separate port to the web-server. For example Cinder's uWSGI application may run on port 8775 whilst the NGinx vhost for Cinder would run on port 8776. This involves installing uWSGI inside the virtual-environment, and configuring a configuration file per service, as well as an init script that runs the uWSGI application. The init script would replace the existing init-script per service NGinx changes: Add a new group for ``nginx_all`` hosts. This would allow us to manage where NGinx is deployed and create flexibility. The default mechanism would be to deploy NGinx inside containers on the infra-hosts, but this could be extended to install NGinx on each service's specific container. Further extend this per service - e.g. ``nginx_nova_placement`` which would be a child of ``nginx_all``, allowing us to configure NGinx per service if required. For example, Swift may need a dedicated NGinx server for the proxy service. Add NGinx as a role requirement for each role, and call the specifics tasks from the role (as in the WIP patch listed at the bottom of the spec). This would allow us to manage where NGinx is running and not enforce a specific architecture. NB NGinx would then "not" be a dependency and would have to be added to the installation playbooks per service. Alternatives ------------ We could force the location of NGinx to be on the same host as the service itself. This would simplify the deployment startegy but would reduce the flexibility significantly. We could use Apache with mod_wsgi although similar architectural decisions apply. Playbook/Role impact -------------------- The roles would need to implement the upstream NGinx role, and the following elements in a playbook would change: * Init scripts * Add nginx as a role requirement * Additional variables for NGinx * Handlers for uWSGI services. * Addition of uWSGI as a dependency. * Potentialy env.d changes to include NGinx hosts. * Adjust role installation playbooks to install NGinx. * Adjust HAProxy settings to point to nginx hosts. * Perform intelligent reloads of services to reduce downtime. Upgrade impact -------------- Upgrades will need to be designed in a way that will implement the NGinx web-server, as well as the uWSGI application, whilst removing the existing Python service. Orchestrating the upgrades may prove difficult in the Ocata to Pike upgrade, which would mean carrying additional machinery for 1 cycle. When moving from Pike to Queen the upgrade path should be simplified. Key aspects to consider: * Stopping existing python applications before start uWSGI. * Starting NGinx in a rolling and orchestrated manner to minimize downtime. Security impact --------------- This would add 2 additional components that are not used everywhere at present. NGinx & uWSGI. Performance impact ------------------ Some monitoring plugins will need to make requests to OpenStack APIs or access certain other services. These plugins must be written carefully to avoid negative performance impacts on the system. End user impact --------------- End users should not notice the changes from this work. The upgrade plays that would move from Ocata -> Pike should handle the work required to configure and setup the NGinx web-server and uWSGI application. Deployer impact --------------- Deployers would need to be aware of the new architecture and understand how and where to implement the NGinx component of the installation. Additionally this would potentially require new containers for the NGinx web-servers. Developer impact ---------------- New roles would need to follow the same pattern set out, once this is implemented. Additionally, the upstream NGinx role would need to be kept up-to-date via tags. Dependencies ------------ Potential dependency on upstream role: * https://github.com/jdauphant/ansible-role-nginx Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Andy McCrae (andymccr) Other contributors: Work items ---------- 1. Write a small class that can be extended for new monitoring plugins. 2. Begin writing monitoring plugins that are executable via setuptools entry points. 3. Ensure that tests are available for each plugin as well as the base class. 4. Create a role to deploy a monitoring tool stack that uses these plugins. 5. Document the plugins and the tool stack. Testing ======= The monitoring plugins should be tested on each commit using tox. The monitoring tool stack role should be tested independently (like the other IRR repos) and added to the integrated build as an optional component. Documentation impact ==================== There are 3 key aspects to documentation: * NGinx performance tuning/options - these could potentially point to the upstream role documentation. * Upgrades may require additional documentation. * Architecture diagrams or documentation may need changes. References ========== WIP Patch to move nova-placement service: * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451425/

commit_message:
Better CI detection in bootstrap-hosts

Rather than setting OpenStack CI settings if running on _any_ nodepool
instance, only set the settings if the ZUUL_URL domain is openstack.org.

This will also prevent the AIO bootstrap from false assertions that it is
running on OpenStack CI anytime it is run on a Zuul gate.

The apt cache timeout has more general appeal to all CI systems, so the
cache_timeout setting is placed if ZUUL_URL is present, even if it is
not openstack.org specific.

Change-Id: I1ef3c9d39632cde1cd30689599b3a4d7b96a3d3e

commit_message:
scripts: openstack-ansible.rc: Check if additional inventory file exists

Commit ba6a3ed899de ("Use Ansible 2.4") added the
/etc/openstack_deploy/inventory.ini by default to the list of
inventories but this file only exists if the following conditional is
true

[[ -d /etc/openstack_deploy/group_vars || \
    -d /etc/openstack_deploy/host_vars ]]

As such, we should check if it's present before we try to make use of
it.

Change-Id: Iaea51edb6bc81c915e035c83d3a805eb450293d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/37/532837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Remove period sign before domain name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-17 17:43:20.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openstack-host-hostfile-setup.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/commit/be07d77f36ddc7d42e45f785b643bc759e7882ed', 'message': "Remove period sign before domain name

The fixed period sign would potentially cause many hidden
problems, especially when 'domain_name' was set to empty string.
And also, it is more important that we hope hostname won't be
changed during the leapfrog. Changed hostname would cause
nova-compute rebuilding nova.compute_nodes table since
nova.instance.node column refers to original hostname.

Change-Id: Ic6ecbff84437d3285d4b81c7dbff71d2e2a193c3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove period sign before domain name

The fixed period sign would potentially cause many hidden
problems, especially when 'domain_name' was set to empty string.
And also, it is more important that we hope hostname won't be
changed during the leapfrog. Changed hostname would cause
nova-compute rebuilding nova.compute_nodes table since
nova.instance.node column refers to original hostname.

Change-Id: Ic6ecbff84437d3285d4b81c7dbff71d2e2a193c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/52/534852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
tests: Do not use ansible_host to pass container IP

The ansible_host variable holds special significance in the connection
plugin that is unrelated to our use of the var in this inventory,
where it is only used to build the network mapping for lxc_container_create.

This masks a bug that breaks the container connection when the
inventory_hostname matches the ansible_host setting.

Change-Id: Ib54e905d5a9ba9fb761a62610012be5cb4e5e59e

commit_message:
Make it possible to override ServiceNetMap per-role

In spine-and-leaf TLS-e deployments as done in OSP13,
services are filter based on role networks when adding
metadata for nova-join. This filtering removes valid
services due to the fact that the roles network does'nt
match the global ServiceNetMap.

Add a role based parameter {{role.name}}ServiceNetMap
that can be used to override the ServiceNetMap per-role
when it's being passed to {{role.name}}ServiceChain and
the {{role.name}} resource group.

Related: RHBZ#1875508
Closes-Bug: #1904482
Change-Id: I56b6dfe8a0e95385e469d9eac97a0ec24e147450
(cherry picked from commit be6a844a79d659525e0feecd5a784e4eb55cb021)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/39/771539/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | When deploying a spine-and-leaf (L3 routed architecture) with TLS enabled for internal endpoints the deployment would fail because some roles are not connected to the network mapped to the service in ServiceNetMap. To fix this issue a role specific parameter ``{{role.name}}ServiceNetMap`` is introduced (defaults to: ``{}``). The role specific ServiceNetMap parameter allow the operator to override one or more service network mappings per-role. For example:: ComputeLeaf2ServiceNetMap: NovaLibvirtNetwork: internal_api_leaf2 The role specific ``{{role.name}}ServiceNetMap`` override is merged with the global ``ServiceNetMap`` when it's passed as a value to the ``{{role.name}}ServiceChain`` resources, and the ``{{role.name}}`` resource groups so that the correct network for this role is mapped to the service. Closes bug: `1904482 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1904482>`_.

commit_message:
Ansible inventory and keepalive support

The ansible inventory for MNAIO is changed to a YAML
format in order to support group references.
The OSA configuration enables keepalived now automatically
once more than one loadbalancer is configured

Change-Id: Ic33488e24425427239a54e41733cbb87c81af2fc

commit_message:
Add new test for the parse_all_validations_on_disk

Add a new test to raise exeception if you have no groups in your playbook.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add new role parameters for cpu/ram/disk allocation ratio

This change adds three new role parameters `NovaCPUAllocationRatio`,
`NovaRAMAllocationRatio` and `NovaDiskAllocationRatio` for
configuring cpu_allocation_ratio, ram_allocation_ratio and
disk_allocation_ratio.
The default values for CPU and Disk allocation ratio are taken
as 0.0 as it will be updated by update_available_resource method
as mentioned in [1].
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html

Conflicts:
    deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml
    puppet/services/nova-base.yaml

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1909661

Change-Id: Ia3c62668b0c1469e31aa8cd2c984b460eb06d970
(cherry picked from commit 5066737451035de19383bf1f7a2afa5334d7d361)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/769394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add new role parameters `NovaCPUAllocationRatio`, `NovaRAMAllocationRatio` and `NovaDiskAllocationRatio` which allows to configure `cpu_allocation_ratio`, `ram_allocation_ratio` and `disk_allocation_ratio`. Default value for NovaCPUAllocationRatio is 0.0 Default value for NovaRAMAllocationRatio is 1.0 Default value for NovaDiskAllocationRatio is 0.0 The default values for CPU and Disk allocation ratio are taken 0.0 as mentioned in [1]. [1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html

commit_message:
Adding configuration directives for Trust behavior

These configuration directives allow for delegation of trusts
from the 'admin' project/domain.

Change-Id: Id4892e5056dae75f31d9199046fdf7dd895ab4f1
Closes-Bug: #1603254

commit_message:
After leapp has been run, verify that the kernel has been upgraded.

This is a new validation to verify the kernel has been upgraded by
checking the kernel version (uname -r) and making sure "el8" appears in it.

Instead of running 'uname -r' - this validation uses the "kernel"
variable from ansible_facts - and checks to see if "el8" is contained
in it.

Change-Id: I3a3c98788a2dfff16412eecaff09f28f7cdef0a6

subject: Transform artcl into a collection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-21 13:03:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-collect-logs/commit/ed3d3380c8b6488c00d629a071c1e6fba6335462', 'message': 'POC: Transform artcl into a collection

Because Ansible official testing tools (ansible-test) cannot be used
without a collection, we change the code layout to make it also
be conformant.

Background: ansible-test provide essential commands for validating
Ansible modules and running unittests on them.

Note: ultimate goal is to keep backwards compatibility and still
be able to use the role as a standalone role.

Lets see if schrodinger role which is also a collection is possible.

commit_message:
Transform artcl into a collection

Because Ansible official testing tools (ansible-test) cannot be used
without a collection, we change the code layout to make conformant.

WARNING: The role is no longer considered to be named
"ansible-role-collect-logs" but "collect_logs" instead, with a
temporary alias called "collect-logs".

Checklist:
- [x] ansible-test sanity checks runs (does not need to pass)
- [x] zuul is still able to use the role
- [x] infrared is still able to use the role
- [x] molecule tests are running and passing
- [x] tripleo-ci jobs still collect the files

One symlink is still needed for infrared until related patch lands:
https://review.gerrithub.io/c/redhat-openstack/infrared/+/508861

Change-Id: Ib87622797a284d837ee579d9cccec0ed73306626
Story: TRIPLEOCI-305

commit_message:
Split network validation to it's own play

When we moved the network deployment to free, we can hit a race
condition where some nodes are being configured prior to the controllers
being ready. This can lead to the basic network validation failing.  We
can deal with this by moving the validation to it's own play so that we
ensure all network configurations have occurred prior to to checking
that nodes can ping the controllers.

Change-Id: I48665379a87e701633be1bcc90bd8be1cc75c513
Closes-Bug: #1913725
(cherry picked from commit 64e735898b8fae7643fc092fed840d867a252046)

commit_message:
Remove tripleoclient file pattern- Standalone scen

Currently, we are triggering Standalone scenario 1/2/3/4/10 on file
patten matching tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_(deploy|config|upgrade) &
tripleoclient/heat_launcher.

All these additional sceanarios are not adding additional coverage,
and vanilla standalone job is enough for coverage.

With this change we are removing these file patterns to avoid trigger
of these Standalone scenarios on the above file pattern.

Change-Id: I8a723aef1e496a9269b374565faa44e90453c6f1

commit_message:
Reconfigure tox.ini

Update minversion of tox to 3.9.0 to support inline comments [1]

Move pep8 and coverage test requirements to tox.ini

Add doc8 test and fix some doc files

[1] https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#v3-9-0-2019-04-17

Change-Id: Iea5fa73ebe2b92fd848b92826b04d04fa0969ac1
